text: Identification of PKCalpha as the Upstream Activator of NF-kappaB in Myeloid Cells

text: As expected , M-CSF increased MDM survival as measured by the percent of <extra_id_0> Annexin V <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / PI negative cells .
Similarly , expression of WT - <extra_id_0> PKCalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protected cells from apoptosis .

These observations demonstrate that <extra_id_0> PKCalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is important in M-CSF - regulated cell survival and NF-kappaB activation and likely regulated through phosphorylation of Ser276 of NF-kappaB <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

To further validate the impact that <extra_id_0> PKCalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> played in M-CSF - induced NF-kappaB transcriptional activity , we next employed <extra_id_0> PKCalpha siRNA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> treatment of MDM or RAW cells .
A pool of specific <extra_id_0> PKCalpha siRNA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were transfected into MDM or Raw 264.7 cells in the presence or absence or M-CSF .
